comments:
Found in I20071029-0010.

Michael, I'm not sure from the stack whether this is your issue or not (but since it's only happening when dragging into the Project Explorer I'll give you the first crack...;-).

Make sure that both the Package Explorer -and- Project Explorer are open and in different stacks.
Create to projects "A" and "B".
Create a file 'foo.txt' in "A"

Dragging 'foo.txt' from the Package Explorer onto project "B" in the Project Explorer results in an error being logged (trace below). Note that this only seems to occur when going from Package to Project explorers; dragging within either works as does dragging from the Project to the Package explorer.

Stack Trace:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.AssertionFailedException: assertion failed: 
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:109)

	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:947)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java:3744)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:3355)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:2395)

I suspect this is due to the fact that the JDT DND Assistant is expecting an IJavaProject, and the PX now uses IProject. 

We can update the JDT extension for an upcoming 3.4 build.
